DOC.brief_summary: This study ass effectiveness solifenacin succinate ( VESIcare ) reduce symptom overactive bladder Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) patient .
DOC.brief_title: Solifenacin Succinate ( VESIcare ) Treatment Overactive Bladder Parkinson 's Disease
DOC.criteria: 1 . Outpatients idiopathic PD accord UK Parkinson 's Disease Society Brain Bank Clinical Diagnosis Criteria . 2 . Age 40 year 80 year . 3 . Stable dose antiparkinsonian medication 4 week prior study entry . 4 . Patients must score 1.0 3.0 Modified Hoehn Yahr scale . 5 . Women childbearing potential must use reliable method contraception . 6 . Must experience symptom overactive bladder accord ICS definition minimum void 8 times/24 hour daily average least 1 episode urgency and/or urinary incontinence ( urge incontinence predominately measure 3IQ diary ) per 24 hour 3day micturition diary period . Patients must documentation OAB within last 6 month . 7 . The patient must evidence PSA le equal 4 ( male ) within last 12 month ( obtain primary care physician ) . 8 . The patient must bladder scan within six month screen visit . This scan use ultrasound technology measure residual fluid level bladder urination . This scan must document post void residual 200 ml less . A bladder scan printout note document finding must provide baseline . 9 . Clearance patient 's internist primary care health provider examine patient within last 6 month . 1 . Any illness investigator 's opinion preclude participation study . 2 . Pregnancy lactation . 3 . Concurrent participation another clinical study . 4 . Dementia psychiatric illness prevents patient give informed consent ( Mini Mental Status Exam score less 27 ) . 5 . Legal incapacity limit legal capacity . 6 . History prostate cancer Transurethral resection prostate ( TURP ) ( male ) . 7 . Presence severe renal disease . BUN 50 % great normal ( normal BUN level within range 5 20 mg/ L creatinine .7 1.4 mg/ L ) . Labs within past 12 month request patient 's health care provider urologist . If labs available within timeframe result abnormal , lab obtain part screen visit . 8 . Presence major hepatic impairment ( cirrhosis , viral hepatitis , nonalcoholic steatohepatitis , Wilson 's disease , Hemochromotosis ) . 9 . Currently take ketaconazole ( antifungal ) CYP3A4 inhibitor itraconazole , ritonavir , nelfinavir , clarithromycin , nefazadone . 10 . Any history bladder outflow obstruction gastrointestinal obstructive disorder . 11 . History narrow angle glaucoma . 12 . Patients undergone pelvic radiation time . 13 . Currently take follow medication : Antiarrhythmics : flecainide ( Almarytm , Apocard , Ecrinal , Fl√©caine ) , digoxin ( Lanoxin , Digitek , Lanoxicaps ) Antipsychotics : thioridazine ( Mellaril , Novorizadine , Thioril ) Tricyclic antidepressant : amitriptyline ( Elavil , Tryptanol , Endep , Elatrol , Tryptizol , Trepiline , Laroxyl ) , amoxapine ( Asendin , Asendis , Defanyl , Demolox , Moxadil ) , clomipramine ( Anafranil ) , desipramine ( Norpramin , Pertofrane ) , imipramine ( Antideprin , Deprenil , Deprimin , Deprinol , Depsonil , Dynaprin , Eupramin , Imipramil , Irmin , Janimine , Melipramin , Surplix , Tofranil ) , nortriptyline ( Aventyl , Pamelor , Nortrilen ) , protriptyline ( Vivactil ) , trimipramine ( Stangyl , Surmontil , Rhotrimine ) Psychotropics : doxepin ( Aponal , Adapine , Sinquan , Sinequan ) Anticholinergics/Antispasmodics : trihexyphenidyl ( Artane , Aparkan ) , benztropine ( Cogentin ) , oxybutynin ( Ditropan , Ditropan XL , Lyrinel XL , Oxytrol ) , darifenacin ( Enablex ) , emepronium , flavoxate ( Urispas ) , meladrazine , propiverine , solifenacin ( Vesicare ) , tolterodine ( Detrol , Detrol LA ) , trospium ( Sanctura ) Selective SerotoninNorepinephrine Reuptake Inhibitors ( SNRI ) : duloxetine ( Cymbalta , Yentreve ) , Venlafaxine ( Effexor , Effexor XR ) Arylalkylamines : pseudoephedrine ( Sudafed ) Antiandrogen : bicalutamide ( Casodex , Cosudex , Calutide , Kalumid ) , finasteride ( Proscar , Propecia , Fincar , Finpecia , Finax , Finast , Finara , Finalo , Prosteride , Gefina , Finasterid IVAX ) , dutasteride ( Avodart , Avidart , Avolve , Duagen , Dutas , Dutagen , Duprost ) , Zoladex ( goserelin acetate ) , Eulexin ( flutamide ) , Lupron ( leuprolide acetate ) Antihypertensives : prazosin ( Minipress , Vasoflex , Hypovase ) Estrogens ( Menest , Premarin , Premarin IV ) Acetylcholinesterase inhibitor ( rivastigmine ( Exelon ) , galantamine , ( Reminyl , donepezil ( Aricept ) , Tacrine . Memantine ( Namenda ) 14 . Urinary obstruction male PD patient diagnose urologist 15 . Active urinary tract infection . 16 . Patients history chronic severe constipation ( self report )
